channel.title: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]
channel.description:
For a while I've been thinking about writing a track and making it available for remix, and I've not seen any covers of the amazing 4' 33" by John Cage on here, so I thought I'd do a cover of it myself.
https://soundcloud.com/lowemasterpro/john-cage-4-33-lowey-cover
If you'd like to remix it then here's the project file: https://app.auxy.co/projects/6xQYFGUFKDGtZ4RxjMUxuw==
And here's the artwork if you'd like to remix that too: http://ma.ttlowe.co.uk/auxy/4-33.png.zip
Enjoy!

item.title: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
cgedius:

reflecting to a kind of painting which use just water without colours on a blank canvas

A good example might be ‘monochrome’ paintings, such as those by Yves Klein or, even better, ‘white paintings’ such as those by Robert Ryman.

The viewer is asked to enquire deeper, and ask questions about what is there – and also what isn’t there.

What does ‘flatness’ mean in a world defined by ‘edges’ and boundaries?
What does ‘silence’ mean (audio or visual) in a world defined by sound/noise?

How closely do we typically look, listen and think?

There’s information and beauty in the detail.

(It’s part of the reason why I enjoy experiencing minimalist art and music so much.)

Read full topic
item.source: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]

item.title: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]
item.dc:creator: lowey
item.description:
cgedius:

but to my understanding

Those 4 words are the most important part of your post: John Cage challenges us to consider, reconsider, challenge and expand our understanding of music, sound, noise and silence.

And my understanding of his statement in 4’33” may very well differ to yours, but the important thing is that you took something away from it and thought a little about the things you assume to be universally true.

Read full topic
item.source: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]

I don’t know nothing about music

item.title: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I absolutely love this! Four minutes and thirty three seconds of pure amazement!

I am intimately familiar with experimental pieces like this from my late harmony classes, so seeing this really made my day. Thank you so much. ^w^

item.title: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]
item.dc:creator: lowey
item.description:
iammane:

No wubs? Wtf

Thought I’d try something different, y’know?

iammane:

Drum programming is WHACK

The drums were a bit of a struggle in this one. You’re welcome to remix it though.

iammane:

How did you get the dog barking sample?

You’re probably best off looking at the project, it’d be too tricky to explain here.

Read full topic
item.source: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]

item.title: 4'33" - John Cage (lowey cover) [classical, experimental, cover, remixable]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Aight so, pretty cool, there’s some problems though.

  1. No wubs? Wtf
  2. Drum programming is WHACK
  3. How did you get the dog barking sample?

Jk perfect way to cap things off prior to this weeks update. Admittedly, I knew of this piece and John Cage but never knew anything about the history of it so I pulled it up on the good old Wikipedia. Great read!

Read full topic
